Having eaten Korean food my whole life I also didn't want it to disappoint.  Great news it doesn't!  We walked in with no reservations and were seated immediately.  Drink and food orders were do e at the same time.  It looked like they had a couple different soju flavors.  Didn't try em but it's soju.  

Wife and I had the shrimp tempura, kimchi pancake and stone pot bibimbap.  Everything was great, wife loved the shrimp tempura as well as the kimchi pancake.  They come out hot and fresh!  The bibimbap was delicious as well.  

Overall I loved it, it can't beat mom's but it's pretty darn great.  Give it a shot and you'll love it.
author: Stan M.

description:
Walked in here unexpected. The place is brand soak in new. I'm so excited that another legit Korean spot is here! No more long lines in the cold for some ddukbbokggi.

Came in was seated promptly. Friendly staff, manager was spot on with service. Had creamy ddukbbokggi. Let me tell you, best in SF. Come try it.

Will definitely be back. Seating is plentiful and you are not all up on the people next to you. My new spot.
author: Alex S.

description:
MY FAVORITE Korean k-pop place. They get you in pretty quickly. The food is ON POINT. Every single thing we've ordered we've loved. Favorites are Army Soup, Corn Cheese, Spicy Clear Noodle with Kimchi, Pork Bibimbap in the thick pot so it has super crusty rice bits. I am salivating just thinking about it. 

The service is always quick awesome. I imagine one of the guys is the owner because he's always super personable and funny. One of those places thats so yummy and great you don't want people to know about it and crowd it out but it's kinda too late, everyone already loves it.
author: Amy C.

description: Best when drunk but is always yummy and good for group events . You don't BBQ yourself so they bring everything out to u but the short ribs and seafood pancakes are to die for!!!
author: Felicia C.

description: We ordered delivery from Zzan, so granted it's probably not their best performance.  Food was good and I'd definitely be up for it again, but just nothing special.  Unfortunately, the tofu soup spilled in the bag, so it was a bit of a mess.  My spicy pork stir fry was tasty, but not really that spicy.  Delivery also took almost 90 minutes, which seems a bit long.
author: Greg B.

description:
I love Korean Food & eaten it in three countries. 
Bibimbap is very simple - basically vegetables usually arranged nicely on top of rice with an egg and some soya bean/ red pepper sauce to mix in.
We ordered this for our vegetarian daughter & asked that it not have mushrooms. When it arrived WITH lots of mushrooms, we politely sent it back to the kitchen. Rather than making a new bowl someone just picked off the first layer of most visible mushrooms and brought it back to the table. Once my daughter started mixing up the vegetables & egg into the rice ( which is the customary way to enjoy this dish), she found more mushrooms. This time she just picked them out herself but really didn't enjoy the dish as the taste of the mushrooms spreads.  
Yes, we could have sent the dish back a second time but it gets stressful to keep doing that. 
My husbands beef ribs were nicely marinated.
My "seafood" bibimbap had far too much hot sauce, 2 shrimps and a few tiny pencil eraser size pieces of squid.
Side dishes were tiny and most lacking in flavour & imagination. Kimchi, bean sprouts, zucchini & seaweed. The seaweed was pretty good.
author: Robin M.

description:
Zzan feels more like a late night k-diner (is that a thing?) for college kids than a restaurant suitable for dinner. I think it's because they gave so few banchan (side dishes) that it felt like we weren't in an authentic Korean restaurant, even though it's run by Koreans and 90% of the patrons were Korean. 

Despite the lacking banchan, the tofu soup and beef soup were pretty good in terms of portion size and taste! All in all, I would go back for a late night bite but would stick to other K restaurants in inner richmond or inner sunset for a "real dinner"
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday and got seated right away.

Ordered the pork feet it was good
Order the fish cake soup was good
Spicy Chicken with cheese sounds weird but it was delicious. 
 if it was a sandwich I would be all over it . Im sure someone has it somewhere
My friends liked the cheese corn
Chicken gizzards were ok
They did a very very good job with their small side dishes .

First time I've been to a Korean restaurant with an all English menu 

Servers were very nice :)

I would come back
author: DOM d.

description:
3 stars only bc i was hungry and the food was ok. It's also close to shopping in the Powell area if you want to get away from the over priced food courts in the shopping centers. 

What I didn't like was the fact that: 
1. They messed up our order (luckily it was the same price as what we originally ordered) 
2. Service is sooooo slow here. Waited over 15mins to get our orders taken. There's only one waitress helping all the tables it seems. 
3. I had to get up twice to ask for an extra spoon.
author: Kim P.

description: I very much enjoyed this place! Their bulgogi is so yummy and croquettes are a MUST! Love that this place is open til 2 am too!
author: Megan B.

description:
Have been here a couple times and it's always great!

I'm not an expert on Korean food but everything I've had here is delicious and flavorful. The service is always fast and the prices are pretty reasonable. The K pop videos in the background are a little distracting but make for a fun atmosphere.
author: Anne M.

description: The service was extremely slow on a Saturday evening at 7:00pm. The waiter was rude and unprofessional. The rice cake skewers that we ordered as appetizers came out five minutes after the entrée. The food was good but having to wait longer than we should killed it for us. The waiter also mixed up our check with another table. I did not feel welcome at this restaurant nor would I recommend it to anyone.
author: Clf L.

description:
Good lunch spot in SF. Very close to downtown area.
BBQ chicken and short ribs lunch boxes are very good and healthy.
Soups and noodles are tasty specially for cold/rainy weather.
author: J Phoenix B.

description: The food was amazing, and the service was great! The rice cakes were by far the best! Hesitated at first, but definitely glad we tried them. I had the spicy tofu soup, and the bf had the ramen seafood. All came out to $40, and portion sizes were well more than enough. Definitely recommend this place for the food and service.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Food was fine but they have shady business practice. I dined there by myself and they included the tip in the charge AND the receipt was saying it's a "PRE"-tip amount (see my pic). I usually don't really look close at the receipt and was writing my tip amount but then realized that the bill shouldn't be above $20 and found out that they already included the tip and didn't tell me anything about it (and it was saying the total bill amount was a pre-tip amount).
author: Anony B.

description: I only come here out of necessity not because of the food. This place never has a long line, and at 2am in the morning that is something you are definitely looking for. There is something off about the taste here. I can't really figure it out, but the cheese corn tastes like plastic to me. There's no sweetness, just a major disappointment. In fact most of the dishes that I've had here don't really live up to my standard of Korean food. However, that's not to say I won't be back here. Typically I go to Cocobang around the corner, but their line is always ridiculously long. Thus, Zzan is an acceptable replacement, or at least I think it is... If you are looking for a legit Korean dining experience this is not the place for that; however, if you are looking to get sub-par Korean food after a night of drinking... I mean I wouldn't say no haha.
author: Alex L.

description: Just ordered two dishes to go. Short ribs and kimchee fried rice. The short ribs were $22, and I kid you not, there are 12 cut up pieces of short rib that came out about 3 minutes after the order was put in. Obviously made well ahead, dry and not all that tasty, but the shocking thing is that it weighs about 5 ounces! Shocking rip off, and will never get one penny more from me! You have been warned about this place so no whining when you are royally ripped off! Kimchee fried rice was adequate
author: terence r.

description: Good Korean fare but NOT family friendly for vacationeers. We were heading to the Rove Kitchen but it was closed so we decided to head across the street to Zzan. They have all the mainstays bulgogi, bibimbap and kimchee pajun. All were excellent especially the pajun. Nice and crispy. However, they should have said 18 and over only because the videos they were projecting on the wall were all MA rated with rappers spewing out one F bomb after another. It was not K-Pop. Plenty of shaking booty and gold rings. So if you have kids under 14, I would come back on a day without them.
author: Alan Y.

description:
They try to be nice. They let you sit while you wait.
The wait for takeout is horrendously long. Like...I could have just gotten served instead.
The food variety is good, prices are decent.

When this place first opened, the fish roe soup was great. It had crabs in it!
Now it doesn't. I guess they figured they don't have to work so hard anymore. It's just watered down stuff.

The bibimbap was good, but I never got it a second time because the first time I chewed on a LOT of dirt in their spinach. Wash your veggies, please.

The noise level and lighting emulate a youth-catered Korean pub. I would like to go in to eat but I can never stay because of the crazy music and lights. I guess they only cater to 19-year-olds.
author: Sera L.

description: I love that this place is so close to my apartment. I am always craving Korean food, and unfortunately, I haven't really found excellent Korean food in the city. Nothing really compared to the LA area. So I was really excited when I found this place. It's not the absolute best Korean food I've ever had, but it's very authentic and the prices don't break the bank. They have awesome lunch specials where you can get a good amount of food for $11-$12. So far, I have tried their lunch special Army Soup and Tofu Soup. Both are good and spicy! The girl who is there during lunch is very nice and I plan to stop by any chance I get during the week. It is also good to note that their lunch special are only on weekdays, and they are open late every day so its a good place to go after a night at Ruby Skye or a Polk Street bar.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
My new favorite Korean restaurant in the city!
Awesome fried chicken, soup, and everything else was great, too.
I'll definitely come back to try some more dishes.
author: Shunji T.

description: Went in at 1030pm, place wasn't too busy. Interior was dark and had korean music videos playing on the walls. Seating was very comfortable and spacious. The menu was simple and the food super fresh and delicious. My friends and I ordered the spicy pork bulgogi, kimchi fried rice, spicy bbq chicken with cheese, soft tofu soup with kimchi, and potato croquettes. The servers were attentive and the food was served fast. This is definitely a place to go to if you want some late night eats with a low key atmosphere.
author: Anna K.

description: Tasted ok, but the portions were tiny and the "runny egg" on top of everything was only half cooked. The white was still runny.  Won't be coming back.
author: Charles N.

description: Good enough but not great. The dishes are not better tasting or have higher quality than the other places around the lower nob hill neighborhood. The banchan has improved since i first went but thats not saying much. The richmond district still has the best korean food.
author: N A.

description: Came here last night with a group of drunk friends and it was so good!! We had the army soup, spicy fried chicken, ttukboki, and fried rice. This will be my new go-to over Sutter 707 (not a fan) and Cocobang. My favorite was the ttukboki, which was a total surprise. One of my friends is a k-town LA boy and even he was impressed.  We also got a pitcher, and of course, as I was serving my friends, I spilled the first cup. What a party foul, i know... BUT they were kind enough to give us a new pitcher! Did not expect that, that is true Korean-style service. I definitely recommend this place!
author: Jennie Y.

description: I was trying to find a really great Korean place close to home and this one was perfect!! A block away!! The food is amazing!! - only BUT, was the VERY poor service that I took two stars out.
author: Jocelyn Z.

description: My husband and I first came here on a night the wait at cocobang was long and we were too lazy and hungry to wait.  We were pleasantly surprised about how good everything was.  They had a similar atmosphere and banchan to cocobang.  The Spicy fried chicken was really good.  Not as sweet as we are used to, but definitely delicious.  The pan fried clear noodle there is really good.  Some other favorites are the sweet creamy pan fried rice cakes and their $0.75 wings on Tuesdays (The soy garlic is a fav).  We have been back several times and are glad we gave it a try.
author: Nicole C.

description: I was in SF for a business trip and ate here 3 times over 4 days. So it is pretty good. If you are w a crowd suggest Army Stew, chicken wings, gal Bi and bul go gi were spot on. Had two of their soups, reminded me of my mom's cooking. Which was a good thing. Having tried several Korean restaurants near by, this one is far the best!  It was loud, I asked them to turn the videos down and I think they did? Don't know it was still loud.
author: Soo B.

description: Definitely one of my favorite Korean restaurants in San Francisco. Some of the dishes are authentic and some are modern/slightly Americanized but the menu is HUGE and there is a wide enough selection to fulfill any Korean craving you may have. I had the creamy rice cakes (with FRESH, not frozen rice cakes AND bacon!), seafood bim bim bop, egg souffle, chicken wings and seafood pancake... WOW. All cooked to perfection and so full of flavor! The service is fast, attentive, and very friendly. Yes, Zzan gets busy and yes, so do the servers, but any good restaurant that's full of customers will be a little loud and bustley at times. Overall, its a great atmosphere to eat and drink and the bill won't wipe out your bank account.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Still got the game. Cocobang and 707 can move aside. Budak was the bomb-julio. Ramen with rice cake was gangsta.
author: Koalie W.

description: Tooooooooo slow! I sat in the restaurant for forty minutes and they did not bring any food out!! There are only two waitress.
author: Tracy X.

description: Great food and service, also beer on tap. Their spicy fried chicken is delicious as well as their army base soup. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu. Coco Bang and 707 have some new competition in the neighborhood. If you are in the area you should stop by ZZAN.
author: Wei W.

description: As far as Korean BBQ, it's one of the worst I've ever had. All the meat had fat dangling from it. The service was average to poor and the prices were exorbitant for the location. We ordered two dishes, the second one came out about 10 minutes after the first one.  Not a good experience at all.
author: Paula A.

description: I was under the weather and needed a hot soup that will make me sweat before I go to bed. The server was kind enough to suggest beef brisket soup as it is spicy and should help with the cold. The portion was huge, but I almost finished it all, as it was pretty flavorful! Now I'm home under the blanket hoping I feel better soon.
author: Aya J.

description: Pretty bad delivery food quality. Worst soft tofu soup I've ever had (all broth, barely any veggies, seafood, or even tofu), asked for side dishes (reason why I ordered, expecting several as they would serve if you sat down) and gave me just fish cake (cheap.) Steamed egg was literally just egg steamed with no veggies but a few scallions. Low quality and skimpy food. Will not order from Zzan again.
author: Kira P.

description: I live across the street and just tried this out yesterday. It was awesome! Quality Korean food, very sweet and helpful staff, no wait, food came out quickly. Reasonable prices. I'll definitely be a regular here. Welcome to the neighborhood, ZZAN!
author: Kyle L.

description:
Honestly, I came by here because 707 was closed for the night and I was craving Korean food, so seeing that this place had recently opened up my girlfriend and I decided to try it out. 

Zzan is a small place - the sign says it only fits 44 people - and the interior is a strange combination of newer, modern lighting and walls that seem to suggest the previous ownership was that of a middle eastern or Indian restaurant. There aren't many tables, and your wait will be significantly longer if a large group happens to snag up some of the precious real estate inside, but for a group of 2 our wait was only about 30 minutes at 8pm on weeknight. In case you didn't know, there is a small podium set up in the left corner hidden by a table (really?) that has a waiting list for you to put your party down on. There has got to be a better way/place for that to be... but it may just be the inefficient layout of the place. They seem a little understaffed so service was slow when we went. The kitchen seemed to be the limiting factor with efficiency and the girls were running between tables and the cashier asking a lot of questions, but they were super nice with seating and service. 

Food-wise, I have no complaints. We started out with an order of the chicken wings which are HUGE. Probably some of the biggest wings I've ever been served at any restaurant. Bigger than 707, and 3 or 4 times bigger than what you would get from a place like Wingstop. And they were delicious. I'm definitely coming back for those.
We also got the kimchi fried rice and a tofu soup bowl because we were cold and hungry and need to pack on the winter insulation. While neither stood out, both were good and satisfying. We did order the soup mild, and it came out pretty red and spicy, which I would have called medium at most other places. Maybe this was a mistake, maybe Zzan just likes to turn up the heat, but thats not a deal breaker. 

Oh, and anther thing that I feel I need to mention - the waitress was amazing at refilling our banchan. We never even needed to ask. More tip for her just for that, since for some reason that is a big part of my Korean food experience. 

Mango soju was pretty good. It came out a little icy at the top, which I'm not not-used to, but the bottom of the pitcher was pretty thick. I should have thinned it with water or something, but that seems like something you aren't supposed to do...

So yes, I will come here again and hopefully try some of their other dishes. Oh, and did you know that they have TUESDAY WING DAY??? 0.75 per wing ($2 on top of that) but if they are the same wings that I got from my regular order I'm DEFINITELY COMING BACK FOR THAT!
author: Kevin S.

description: Vegetarian and Vegan friendly! Great bibimbap for the right price, and the stone bowl stays very hot. The banchan is also a plus. Flavors are on point. Happy hour until 8. Convenient hours and good service. KPop video wall is a plus for entertainment. Overall, an excellent experience. Would come back again with friends. I could imagine that the late hours on weekends means a full house. I prefer this place more than 707.
author: Kayla F.

description: Came here with my willingness to try their food during Thanksgiving. Waiter told to wait for 10-15 mins. As we saw them started putting utensils on the table, we walked into the restaurant. However, we were asked to wait outside for more time during winter time, which we did. We kept waiting for 10 more mins and they welcomed a group of 3 people which belong to same culture background as the restaurant. We walked in to question them why let other people in first. They told us that group came 30 mins ago and they just came back. Excuse me???? They left and they can still get their seats? That doesn't make sense to me. We questioned again the table that they were preparing for? We were told that's reserved. During the whole process, waiters were not polite and welcoming. It appeared that they don't care your business. Won't give it a try although I pass by here everyday from work. Do not recommend.
author: Wei C.

description: I can only vouch for the soft tofu soup, but it was some of the best I've had in a long time. Awesome for a cold rainy night. The ambiance here is kind of weird (bad techno music?) but worth it for the soup.
author: Jo B.

description: Nasty nasty nasty nasty nasty nasty.... coco bang is much better. Service is better than the foods. We ordered stir fry octopus with noodle which i was exciting about, it turns out BLEEEEEH. Beef dumpling taste like frozen food, calamari tempura its alright.... the rice dish came 30 min later n they forgot my hubby dinner. :( i guess this is why i hate going to new a restaurant.! I wont recommend this place at all !!!!
author: Nita D.

description: As a Korean who has spent half her life in Korea, I have been unimpressed with the Korean food in San Francisco. Zzan is mediocre, plain and simple, but it hits the spot when cravings call. The big thing has been a lack of flavor in every dish I've ordered -- even the bbibimbap was bland, and that's where I draw the line. I will return to Zzan, inevitably as I cannot escape the beckoning of meals that remind me of home. However, I do hope that the quality and flavor of the food improves with each visit.
author: Alyssa M.

description: Service is lacking.  They dont even pick up the phone sometimes.  I think they have staffing problems.  As a result, they have this hurry up unfriendliness attitude.  The food is pretty good though.  I would still come back for take-outs.  Not a place I would highly recommend though.
author: Jack T.

description: I live in the neighborhood and was craving ramen, but stumbled across this new place so decided to give it a shot. My roommate got the bibimbap and I got a tofu soup with ramen noodles and veggies. I was excited for all the side dishes that typically come with Korean food, but there were only 3 different kinds. I asked if there were others and she said there was one more - a potato dish- but that she didn't think that we would like it. What?? Why would we not like it? And why would you say that to us and not bring it to us? I asked for her to bring it and it was tasty - the regular sweet, miso-y potato you get at all Korean restaurants. My roommate's bibimbap looked great, and she said it was great, but my tofu soup was lacking. It hit the spot on a cold day, but it was pricey for what it was. Next time, I'll check out a different Korean place.
author: Amy Y.

description: Terrible. Actually first time I can think of being this disappointed in an SF restaurant. The food was extremely spicy, despite picking "mild". When I said something they said "oh that's just the way it is, we get a lot of complaints about that." Huh? If you get complaints, notate that an item is spicy, especially when "mild" is an option. They had four people talk to me, and only the fourth offered a resolution. The quality and portion sizes were also very bad and small. Would definitely not go back nor recommend.
author: Mike J.

description: Great-tasting Korean food, including traditional items like Korean Sausage. The music was a bit too loud to talk at times, but I am guessing they are still finding their optimal vibe. With a mix of Korean and other music videos projected on the wall, you can get your fix of Korean boy/girl bands as a side dish.
author: Max M.

description: Yum!  Another solid casual Korean spot with the favorites: gal bi, jap chae, jjam bong, and soon doo boo.  We didn't try everything yet, but the dishes we had were flavorful and hit the spot.  Service is super friendly and helpful.  Our order took a little longer than I expected, but not so long that it was unreasonable.  Also, you get a little less selection of banchan than other places, but the quality was pretty good so better than a big plate of wilted veggie sides.  We'll definitely be back!
author: Michelle C.

description: Best late night Korean food in town! Great food, beer on tap, awesome service from owner Shawn. Try their kalbi tang, kararage, and korean sausage. Forget 707 and Cocobleh! Zzan is the real deal!
author: zhen t.

description: So happy this place opened up around the corner from my home. The food is amazing, some of the best Korean food I've ever had. Special shout out to Ara, she's so sweet and helpful. Love, love , love this place!!
author: paul b.

description: It holds some good HEALTHY Korean food in the Nob Hill area. You can see  and taste that it has low grease and that everything is fresh. They are super friendly and they always make sure you have a good time! Go Zzan for opening late as well!
author: Joseph V.

description: I just ordered the kimchee chigae (stew) thru DoorDash app and it was one of the best I've ever had. Arrived on time, was still hot, and came with 2 banchan sides (that were delish) and rice. The stew had a great flavor from the pork belly they used. The real way to make it! I don't know much about the rest of the food but their kimchee soup gets 5 stars. Com som nee dah!
author: A W.

description: Lovely place, big seating area so you can avoid waiting. Meat lovers are gonna enjoy the variety of chicken they have here. We had the bibimbap (authentically hot and crispy at the bottom) and the chicken and cheese - it's like eating elevated pizza without the crust.
author: Isabella D.

description: I was ordered for pick up but when I pick the food back to my home I find it only one coke but I ordered two. And also no chopsticks and napkin. It's a bad experience and I  don't have any mood to eat the food
author: Yue J.

description: Love this place. Not too much Korean food options around, but this is my go-to place. Usually get the vegetable tofu soup and pork belly to go, but came in for dinner today and was really happy with the service. Everyone was very nice, quick, and attentive.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Worst Korean food I've ever inhaled. The beef short rib. Was tough. They have discovered the step past well done
author: Leslie M.

description: I would give no stars if I could. Worse korean food in SF. Everything tasted like it was frozen and made from not fresh ingredients. Portions were big but if you are looking for real korean food this is not the right place.
author: Jessica L.

description: Nice place inside, good service, fun K-pop videos but not too noisy, and food was very good. Definitely worth coming back.
author: Ron C.

description: Corn and melted cheese!!! Everything was so tasty! Now one of my favorite Korean restaurants. The service was great as well!
author: Juliane A.

description: I love creamy tteokbeoki and tofu soup. Its my favorite korean food! great servics and I like that they have alot of apps that I could order the food
author: Terisa R.

description: Been to Seoul and Busan and points in between.  This is real.  Good. Low key and solid.
author: Jeff T.

description: I've looked for Korean BBQ in the city and finally found this place!! Their short ribs are amazing!!!
author: Abby W.

description: My favorite cream ddeokbokki! Perfect for SF :) So good and cant wait to come back! Make sure to try it when you come!!
author: Silvia C.

description: Great korean food and service. Service was fast. Server keep refilling our water and also mixing our drink which is cool!
author: Jason H.

description: Do not order pick up from this place. On busy nights (usually most nights), your wait time can be expected to be any where from 2-2.5 times what the cashier tells you. The food is mediocre at best.
author: Alex W.

description: beware, the noise level is nuts.  too many drunk people and the noise travels.  food is not bad, tasty and alot of choices and server seems nice.  helpful but probably need more help. price is not expense but not cheap.  opens late, so it's good for late night but again, the noise is just a bit too much.
author: Food Is L.

description: Korean food is my favorite and I lived in Korea for almost a year so I know what good Korean food is. I ordered the kalbi. The menu had a section called small plates with dukpokki on it. Thinking this was appetizer size I ordered that as well.  The kalbi was good. Typical of what you find in the US when cooked in the kitchen and not at the table. The dukpokki was amazing!! I haven't had any that good since I was in Korea. And I've had it all over from coast to coast. And it was a huge bowl, not the "small plate" I was expecting. I ate it and took most of my kalbi to go.  The kimchi was also very good. A little salty, but all the right flavors and actually  fermented. Kimchi is just not kimchi without that zing on your tongue. I was very pleasantly surprised as it looked like it would just be another watered down, wanna-be, trendy Korean place. I read a few reviews here afterwards and all the bad ones ordered things that are not traditional Korean dishes. I imagine they need to have those dishes for those with "American" palates.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: you should try dolsot bibibab with bulgogi. don't forget gochujang when you mix it :)
author: Trent L.
